title: The molecular basis for Pompe disease 3 revealed by the structure of human acid α-glucosidase 4 5

C-terminal to the catalytic (β/α) 8 domain, the GAA 110 structure contains two additional β-sandwich domains. Domain C1 spans residues 727-820 and 111 is composed of seven antiparallel β-strands in 5-and 2-stranded β-sheets. The C2 domain has 112 a β-sandwich topology and is composed of 10 β-strands in two 5-stranded β-sheets, with two 113 small α-helices inserted ( Fig. 1 and Fig. 1 supplement B) . and the surface-exposed C938 and C952 in the C2 domain (Fig. 1) .
